Label: PtdIns(5)P
Comment: aka phosphatidylinositol 5-phosphate</br>phosphorylated on position 1 and 5; position 1 connected to DAG.</br>Localization: Nucleus</br>Function: Apoptosis

Label: DAG
Comment: Diacylglycerol

Label: PtdIns(4,5)P2
Comment: phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate</br>Localization: Plasma membrane, Nucleus</br>Function: Endocytosis, cytoskeletal dynamics

Label: PtdIns(3,5)P2
Comment: phosphorylated on position 1, 3 and 5; position 1 connected to DAG.</br>Localization: Endosomes</br>Function: Osmotic stress responses, signaling, vacuole homeostasis

Label: PtdIns
Comment: phosphorylated on position 1; position 1 connected to DAG.

Label: PtdIns(3)P
Comment: phosphorylated on position 1 and 3; position 1 connected to DAG.</br>Localization: Endosomes</br>Function: Endocytic membrane traffic, autophagy, phagosome maturation

Label: PtdIns(3,4)P2
Comment: phosphorylated on position 1, 3 and 4; position 1 connected to DAG.</br>Localization: Plasma membrane</br>Function: Signaling, phagocyte oxidase, cytoskeletal dynamics

Label: PtdIns(4)P
Comment: phosphorylated on position 1 and 4; position 1 connected to DAG.</br>Localization: Golgi</br>Function: Golgi-to-PM traffic

Label: PtdIns(3,4,5)P3
Comment: phosphorylated on position 1, 3, 4 and 5; position 1 connected to DAG.</br>Localization: Plasma membrane</br>Function: Signaling, cytoskeletal dynamics

Label: Ins(1,4,5)P3
Comment: phosphorylated on position 1,4 and 5.

Label: 4-phosphatase
Comment: From [https://www.qmul.ac.uk/sbcs/iubmb/enzyme/EC3/1/3/78.html and https://enzyme.expasy.org/EC/3.1.3.78] :'Two pathways exist in mammalian cells to degrade 1-phosphatidyl-1D-myo-inositol 4,5-bisphosphate [PtdIns(4,5)P2] [2]. One is catalysed by this enzyme... The enzyme from human is specific for PtdIns(4,5)P2 as substrate, as it cannot use PtdIns(3,4,5)P3, PtdIns(3,4)P2, PtdIns(3,5)P2, PtdIns5P, PtdIns4P or PtdIns3P [2].In humans, the enzyme is localized to late endosomal/lysosomal membranes [2].' [2]: [PMID: 16365287]

Label: SACM1L
Comment: Annotation based on Uniprot ' Can also catalyze the hydrolysis of phosphatidylinositol 3-phosphate (PtdIns3P)' and EC.3.1.3.64

Label: PIP-4 kinase
Comment: According to Rhea, this is the EC class.

Label: MTM1
Comment: aka Myotubularin; gene name given in Fig. 1 of [PMID:16554828].

Label: SHIP (1)
Comment: EC:3.1.3.86. Annotated based on caption of Fig. 1 [PMID:16554828] and 'Src homology 2 (SH2) domain containing inositol polyphosphate 5-phosphatase 1 (SHIP1)' [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/INPP5D]

Label: PIP-5 kinase gamma
Comment: 'PIP5Kγ, has three splicing variance; PIP5Kγ635, PIP5γ661, and PIP5Kγ687, making it one of the key regulators for producing PI(4,5)P2' [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phosphatidylinositol-4-phosphate_5-_kinases_(PIP5K)_in_neuronal_development]

Label: PIP-5 kinase gamma
Comment: 'PIP5Kγ, has three splicing variance; PIP5Kγ635, PIP5γ661, and PIP5Kγ687, making it one of the key regulators for producing PI(4,5)P2' [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phosphatidylinositol-4-phosphate_5-_kinases_(PIP5K)_in_neuronal_development]

Label: 4-phosphatase
Comment: From [https://www.qmul.ac.uk/sbcs/iubmb/enzyme/EC3/1/3/78.html and https://enzyme.expasy.org/EC/3.1.3.78] :'Two pathways exist in mammalian cells to degrade 1-phosphatidyl-1D-myo-inositol 4,5-bisphosphate [PtdIns(4,5)P2] [2]. One is catalysed by this enzyme... The enzyme from human is specific for PtdIns(4,5)P2 as substrate, as it cannot use PtdIns(3,4,5)P3, PtdIns(3,4)P2, PtdIns(3,5)P2, PtdIns5P, PtdIns4P or PtdIns3P [2].In humans, the enzyme is localized to late endosomal/lysosomal membranes [2].' [2]: [PMID: 16365287]
